name: Island Defense
description: Get ready for modern battles! Defend your islands against evil invaders in jungles! Your team will consist of modern snipers, gunners, rockets, ice towers and other great things. A deep conflict has been brewing between you and the evil invaders. Fight to protect your freedom and liberty.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Service Pack 3 Processor: Dual Core CPU Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 3.0 compliant with 512MB of video RAM. Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP Service Pack 3 Processor: Dual Core CPU Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 3.0 compliant with 1.0GB of video RAM. Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: One repetitive bit of background music. No zooming in our out. Buttons located on top and bottom of screen where it's impossible to use them without causing the screen to scroll. Unpredictable pathing so sometimes enemies walk twice as far through a map as they need to. Unsatisfying to upgrade since usually another cheap tower would be more cost-effective, except that you run out of places to put new towers. Windowed mode doesn't seem to work. Occasional crashes.  Island Defense very much wants to be Kingdom Rush, but it's a very poor man's Kingdom Rush. I've got some hours in, but I'm a hopeless tower defense nut always looking for things I haven't already played. You can probably do better.

For Achievement Hunters: Achievements are broken for 4 out of the 16.  For everyone else: The game has no ending, no story, 4 out of the 6 towers are useless beyond level 1. Heroes are mostly useful for only their power ups and die a little too quickly when fighting. Doesn't require that much strategy once you realize the majority of upgrades are useless and you spam towers. Not really worth the time to play.  Art in the game is pretty good and was the inital reason I tried it out. The Venus Fly Trap known as Island Defense got me good.

I think that is a decent tower defence game.
